dmca.title: Photographer Requests 512 Takedown or Re-attribution (#2)
dmca.body:
Hi,
Your webmaster said I should contact you about an image of mine that is coming up first on your image search pages from a Spanish site which does not have permission to use it. He said I should use the following format to request removal from the site or preferably re-attribute it to my site using the following url: http://www.richard-cooke.com/harriers/previewpages/previewpage1.htm. The picture on my web site is a lower resolution, vertical crop of the picture but it is exactly the same one. There is only one picture like this in the world and I took it.

1.
http://images.google.co.uk/imgres?imgurl= www.telcom.es/~jcastjr/aviones/harrier.jpg&imgrefurl= http://www.telcom.es/~jcastjr/aviones/modernos.html&h=456&w=496&sz= 52&tbnid=mNuj6vZID5IJ:&tbnh=l16&tbnw=126 &prev=/images%3Fq%3Dharrier%26svnum %3D10%26hl%3Den%26lr%3D%26ie%3DUTF- 8%26oe%3DUTF-8 
This is NOT my site and does not have my permission to use this picture.

2. 
My email address is [Private]@[private].freeserve.co.uk.

3. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that, for the image identified above, I am the copyright owner.

4.
[Private]

5.
This email is being sent to [private]@google.com
